A key reason to pay your television bill is to remain in compliance with the law. Depending on the country, it may be illegal to not pay for television services. The law in some countries may require that you pay for a license to watch television, which must be renewed annually. Additionally, a television service provider may have certain terms and conditions that are legally binding, such as a requirement to pay for the services. 

In some cases, failure to pay your television bill may be considered a criminal offense. Depending on the country this may be punishable by fines, jail time, or both. It is also important to note that if you are found guilty of not paying your television bill, it can have an effect on your credit rating. This may make it difficult for you to get other services or take out future loans.
